name: Familial Hypophosphatemic Rickets with Hypercalciuria
chief_complaint: My child has been having bone pain and isn't growing like other kids their age
prognosis: Good with early treatment, but requires lifelong management. Untreated cases may develop severe skeletal deformities and growth retardation.
description: A rare X-linked dominant disorder of phosphate metabolism caused by mutations in the PHEX gene. Characterized by renal phosphate wasting leading to hypophosphatemia, defective bone mineralization, and paradoxically elevated urinary calcium excretion due to compensatory 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D production.
